Post_Title: If being gay is immoral, a sin, or wrong, then god intentionally created people who he knew would go against his wishes through no fault of their own
post_text:
Being gay is not something you can choose to be. It is a part of a personâ€™s personality and overall life, and is not something you can force yourself to not be. Why would god create all of these people when he knew that they were going to be like this, and that they had no choice?

Gay people are not attracted to people of the opposite sex. This means that god expects them to either live a life of misery in which they cannot be with someone they truly love, or live a life of sin where they *can* be happy and their true selves.

Threads.Reply_Text: Your thinking is flawed, there's no existence if a gay gene meaning God didn't create anyone gay. Homosexualiry comes from trauma during the developmental cycle, it's not natural

Replies.Reply_Text: Lol what?

There's a masculine gene and a feminine gene, there's no existence of a gay gene, bottomline. My profession is a domestic abuse counselor, my masters is in psychiatry. 100% of my homosexual clients, once opening up, have all had a really sad story that explains why they became homosexual. It's emotional and/or physical trauma which rewires the brain during the developmental cycle. If you want to pose the argument that individuals are born gay, then you must first discover the existence of a gay gene, otherwise you have no argument at all

You sound like the disgraced and deceased Joseph Nicolosi.  I feel sorry for the people you so grossly misinform. I have two post graduate degrees and the nonsense you are spewing was debunked years ago
Iâ€™m surprised you havenâ€™t been sued for incompetence and malpractice

Youâ€™re a domestic abuse counselor. 100% of all your client, once opening up, have had a really sad story. Youâ€™re just assuming the trauma makes them gay and coincidentally NOT assuming trauma makes someone straight.

How do you explain the hundreds of animal species partaking in homosexuality? Do you really think that they experienced trauma to make them gay? How ridiculous does that sound. Nevertheless, there *absolutely* is some evidence of homosexuality being linked to genetics.

"The human X chromosome with [Xq28](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xq28)(green) located at the tip of the long arm of the chromosome. Studies of the X chromosome as well as the entire human genome have linked Xq28 to the heredity of homosexuality in human males."

However, not enough research or evidence is made available to the true direct cause of homosexuality. It is theorized that it is due to a multitude of reasons including genetic, hormonal, and environmental.
Your â€œinformation â€œ apparently comes from 1952. That notion was debunked decades ago ðŸ™„

I live in 2023 where there is still no existence if a gay gene, my college education definitely wasn't then because I wasn't born then. If you have no facts to substantiat your false beliefs, yet you still choose to argue with yourself, then you are a fool. I've only stated proven facts, not theories. But carry on if you find comfort in ignorance

Youâ€™re just spouting hateful Christian rhetoric and nonsense . I have two post graduate degrees in religious studies and I became an atheist because Christians are the first in line to parrot what they have heard from some religious authority. In my decades of being a pastor I found the average Christian has little or no knowledge even about scripture or science.  You clearly fit the bill

You do know that not everything that is genetic can be reduced to one gene, right?  Even eye color has multiple genes that influence it.

Your biological sex is due to a complex interaction with no less than three genes on multiple chromosomes.  And that is ignoring the gene pathways for the hormone receptors that take the output of those genes and influence the sexual development.  Certain configurations of the first series of genes could produce hormones to signal the body to develop male typical anatomy even if no Y chromosome is present.  Certain configurations of the second pathway might prevent the reception of those hormones leading the body to produce female typical anatomy anyway.

There's no 'male' or 'female' gene either.  You could point to the Y chromosome and say there is a 'male' chromosome, but there are and have been people with XY chromosomes who nevertheless develop a uterus and ovaries and are able to get pregnant and give birth to offspring and in every way appear to be female. In the same way there have been and are XX chromosome males with functioning testes that are capable of producing viable sperm.

There's no gay gene, because that's not how genetics works.  That doesn't change the fact that sexual orientation is at least in part genetic.
Alot of typing to not even have a point to make. You are dismissed.

You were saying there's no gay gene as a way of suggesting that means sexual orientation isn't in part biologically determined.

That there's no gay gene doesn't mean that at all.  There's no biological sex gene either, but I'm sure you'd agree that biological sex is genetically determined and that people are born biologically male or female or some variation of those.

There's also no left handed gene, or eye color gene.  It's rare for some physical traits to be controlled by one specific gene.
Do you think that god Is all knowing
Do you think you can choose who you love? Of course not, you like people you like, you don't choose to like them

Which has nothing to do with trauma. Did you not understand anything that I previously stated? Some fall in love with their kidnappers as well, that condition also has a name, and there's nothing natural about it. There are pedophiles that believe that they genuinely love their victims. By your logic they should be accepted rather than imprisoned and treated right?

But you're the one who said it had to do with trauma, what are you talking about?
In both cases that you mentioned, the relationships are harmful and/or do not have consent from both parts, that is, one part love, but the other don't, unlike a homosexual relationship, where both people love each other, just like a heterosexual one.
Why are you ignoring my response? You downvoted me and then just ignored it lmao. Your thinking is so illogical. Homosexuality is absolutely not solely caused by trauma and the environment.

>there's no existence if a gay gene

Wow, you've mapped the entire human genome and understand what every sequence does?

>Homosexualiry comes from trauma during the developmental cycle

Please describe what these "traumas" are, and provide the studies showing how 100% of gay people and 0% of straight people have gone through these traumas.

>it's not natural

So swans, ducks, penguins, dolphins, bats, bison, elephants, bonobos, gorillas, hyenas, and other animals undergo these same "traumas"?
You have no facts to substantiate your argument, so how can you present an argument?

I'm always under NDA, do one example we'll call "Kimmy". She always felt that she had always been gay, she's always been attracted to females and turned off by female. A couple months in she told me about suppressed memories returning. They were of her older brother forcing her to perform oral sex on her. And since you obviously don't possess the intellectual fortitude to understand basic things, I'll explain it to you. What this does, especially when a big brother, a father, are meant to protect, it pushed her away from all males. All men were unsafe, so as she developed further, reaching the age of wanting companionship, solace was found in the same sex. Ironically, Kimmy developed a romantic interest in me. Because trust was established. That's one example, I have hundreds, there's never been an exception. You, on the other hand have knowledge of facts nir experience to base assumptions on. You just want to attempt to make an argument because of your false beliefs and lack the humility to investigate the validity of your beliefs

>That's one example, I have hundreds, there's never been an exception.

In your job as a trauma counselor, you've never had a person who wasn't traumatized? Don't you think there might be a little tiny bit of selection bias happening here?

Or do you mean you've never had an exception in that every gay person you've worked with was abused by someone of the opposite sex (never of the same sex), never before had any attraction for the opposite sex, but then after your counseling they began to be attracted to the opposite sex?
